Reviews.Title: “Very nice for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Päivi V
Reviews.Content: We stayed here four nights on the top floor. Room was very spacious. Breakfast was very good. We paid only EUR 135 (4 nigts, two people, inc. breakfast). The location was great; very easy to go everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Greenroses
Reviews.Content: Location is good, next to the U-bahn and a ten minute walk from Potzdammer platz, but the area has seen better days, not a decent restaurant in sight, lots of kebab houses though! Rooms are small, bathrooms even smaller, and breakfast is very average for a Berlin hotel. The rooms over the street are slightly larger but troubled by traffic noise. Staff is russian and rather unflexible. Our booking , confirmed and paid for, had got lost in their system and it took too long to sort out.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent stay for one night in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: 0andriy
Reviews.Content: We were in Berlin on March 2011 for one day. I booked the hotel Delta beforehand. It was nice staying there. The hotel is located near to U-Bahn station and Tiergarten park. We had a good breakfast and warm room for normal price. The facilities were in full range from nice bathroom to non-creaky bed (you know what I meant). So, definitely I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: busy-aussie-bee
Reviews.Content: This hotel was simple and nice with good rooms and breakfast. It is an ok walk or easy cab ride to the sony centre / checkpoint charlie end of town but you need to know where you are going as it's not really on an obvious road. If you are looking for a cheap convenient hotel in Berlin then this would be a good match. Only downside was while rooms were large they were a bit hot in summer and didn't have aircon. Opening a window and turning on the fan provided was enough to keep comfy though!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable. Good value”
Reviews.Author: DeebWales
Reviews.Content: Excellent breakfasts. Friendly and helpful staff. Advertised as having a bar - there wasn't one. Is there a Trades Description Act in Germany, or has something been lost in translation?

Reviews.Title: “Great place great stuff fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: MEIRZ
Reviews.Content: Me & wife stayed in that hotel for 5 nights. everything clicked like a swiss watch. location- line u1 just 3 minutes walk. Service -helpful stuff, clean roon,very good breakfast,fast elevator. lacted on small quiet street yet close to 3 supermarkets .bike rental etc'. We came on first day 12 o'clock at night yet restaurants were opened(kafe,burger king,pizza,icecream kebab good eastern food (very fare prices.) very good place to explore Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Very average”
Reviews.Author: Eagleton
Reviews.Content: Dont expect anything much here. The rooms are extremely basic and the beds are hard! The service is far from wonderful - the staff will not go out of their way to make your stay more enjoyable. The breakfast is also very basic. It's not that the place is bad at all, its simply extremely average in every way, which I suppose is reflected in its price. To its benefit, it is located near U-bahn stations, which is good to get around town. Also, its a short walk to Potsdamer Platz and the Reichstag/Unter den Linden area (which is where most touristy things are). In other words, the location is good for its price.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal”
Reviews.Author: Itamarl
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a great location: one minute from the U-Bahn station, 10 minutes walk from PotsdamerPlatz and 15-20 minutes walk from KuDam. Excellent breakfast, even for us Kosher eating. Nice and comfortable room. Pleasant atmosphere and helpful staff. Graet deal for the money.

Reviews.Title: “berlin on a budget”
Reviews.Author: rgs258
Reviews.Content: Inexpensive and spacious for the price. Friendly service, and near enough to everything you’ll want to do (most places are a ~10 minute walk away). I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly hotel on a quiet street”
Reviews.Author: MatureCultureLover
Reviews.Content: Called from Tegel airport and the lady at the hotel reception had a room at a reasonable price. She gave me very clear directions to the hotel. The room was very clean and pleasant, and the bathroom was a good size with a nice shower stall. Very comfortable bed. Good breakfast bar the next morning. The staff were all friendly and pleasant. I really enjoyed my stay here, and would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pity about the location”
Reviews.Author: rayondesoleil1976
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because I wanted to stay near to Potsdamerplatz during my last stay in Berlin. I should have known in advance - as a general rule it is always better to find accommodation in the East of the city. Anything you will want to do will be in the 'Mitte' area which is in the East. On arrival I was extremely concerned by the location of the hotel. There was a sex shop on the corner opposite it and lots of 'working girls' in the street next to the one the hotel is situated in. As a lone female traveller I was rather uncertain about even staying in the hotel given its situation. The hotel is situated close to two main U-Bahn station which makes it easy to escape the area. I just stuck to taxis when returning at night to the hotel. The hotel itself is fine. The hotel staff are extremely friendly and helpful and there is a 24 hour reception. (You have to buzz to get in after a certain time.) You also drop your key off when leaving the hotel which gives you one less thing to worry about carrying around with you during the day! I was a little disappointed with the room. I stayed in the Circus Hostel the year before and was really impressed by the size of the room I had there - and this has been my usual experience of hotels in Berlin. My single bed was not very comfortable - quite narrow. So narrow I was scared to turn over for fear of falling out of bed! The window didn't close either which made it noisy at night! On the plus side there was a good shower room with a fairly decent shower cubicle. There was also a mini bar which was free to use(!) and a TV in the room with a mixture of English language and German language stations. I would be reluctant to recommend this to anyone visiting Berlin - especially for the first time! Berlin is a safe city and very pleasant city to stay in . This has got to be the first time I have felt unsafe or uncomfortable walking around the city on my own. There are many better hotels in the city - and also the excellent Circus Hostel. Try elsewhere before settling for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One Star at Best”
Reviews.Author: KeepinItSimple
Reviews.Content: Motel 6 meets Youth Hostel accomodations a la' 1980s with a 60's facade.

Reviews.Title: “Out of the way hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laura2610
Reviews.Content: Although there was an U-Bahn line very near to the hotel, it wasn't really within walking distance of anywhere nice to eat or drink or any shopping facilities other than small supermarkets. The reception and breakfast area are very small, although the receptionists were generally friendly and helpful. We had breakfast just one of the mornings we stayed; it wasn't included in the price and was a bit expensive for what was available. Our room was large, with a good bathroom. There was a mini-fridge (very helpful in the middle of summer) and a large balcony outside which we shared with one other room. The only problem with the room was the fact that the door onto the balcony was the only means of getting air into the room and it only opened out wide. This meant leaving the door open wide all night, which wasn't ideal as our balcony was accessible from all the floors of the hotel. There were no fans available in the hotel, so the room was always uncomfortably hot. Generally, I wouldn't recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: nikzik
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks like a factory on the out side. They have cleverly disguised its look on the website photos by putting people in front of a massive gate. Inside reception is small and dingy. The rest of the hotel isn't much better. The room was a very odd shape and it was difficult to find anywhere to put anything. the tv didn't work properly. it wasn't very clean. the room was smelly. There was no air conditioning or fan. The bed was uncomfortable. There isn't much to do in the area. On the plus side, the staff were ok. I would not stay here again, I i wouldn't stay in the area again either.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: ajw42
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights with my teenage daughter; we had a clean twin room with comfortable beds. Location is good - 2 blocks from 2 U-bahn lines; walking distance (0.5km) south of Potsdamer Platz. Breakfast is worth the fee (E10/person) if you like a full meal to start the day - otherwise skip it and go to a cafe. helpful staff. We'd happily go back.

HotelInfo.Name: CCA Delta Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Pohlstrasse 58, 10785 Berlin, Germany
